discussion.content:

Selected Answer: C
confirmed via documentation C

Selected Answer: CD
I agree with CD

Predefined Database Service Names for Autonomous Database
The tnsnames.ora file provided with the credentials zip file contains the database service names that allow you to connect to your database.

The available predefined service names differ depending on your workload. The different services provide different levels of performance and concurrency for Autonomous Database connections.

Workload Type and Database Service Names
Data Warehouse
- dbname_high
- dbname_medium
- dbname_low

Transaction Processing
- dbname_tpurgent
- dbname_tp
- dbname_high
- dbname_medium
- dbname_low

JSON Database
- dbname_tpurgent
- dbname_tp
- dbname_high
- dbname_medium
- dbname_low

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-database/serverless/adbsb/connect-predefined-generic.html#GUID-E49773B3-6C07-4F6F-906B-42705D237523

choices.C: Cloning creates a copy of the source DB system as it exists at an earlier time, including the storage configuration software and database volumes.
choices.A: Cloning creates a copy of the source DB system as it exists at the time of scheduling the cloning operation, including the storage configuration software and database volumes.
choices.B: Cloning creates a copy of the source DB System as it exists at a later time, including the storage configuration software and database volumes.
choices.D: Cloning creates a copy of the source DB system as it exists at the time of the cloning operation, including the storage configuration software and database volumes.

questions.question_text:
You want to have an exact copy of your database system to demonstrate the feasibility of a method you have in mind. You decide to clone your database system.
Which of the following statement is true about cloning a database system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
confirmed via documentation C

Selected Answer: A
confirmed via documentation A

Selected Answer: D
I agree with D. Cloning creates a copy of the source DB system as it exists at the time of the cloning operation, including the storage configuration software and database volumes.

Selected Answer: D
The correct statement about cloning a database system in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) is:

D. Cloning creates a copy of the source DB system as it exists at the time of the cloning operation, including the storage configuration software and database volumes.

Selected Answer: D

Selected Answer: B
The total meteredBytes shown by the File Storage service after the hourly update cycle would typically be:

B. 2 GB

This is because the snapshot typically consumes storage space equal to the size of the data in the file system at the time the snapshot was taken. In this case, you took a snapshot after adding a 2 GB file, so the snapshot would be 2 GB in size.

https://docs.oracle.com/es-ww/iaas/Content/File/Concepts/FSutilization.htm
B

Selected Answer: D
Correct anwer is D.
D it's wrong, because you need to take a snapshot of the file system, so after the hourly update cycle you'll have 4GB.
It's wrong because you need to take a snapshot of the file system, so after the hourly update cycle you'll have 4GB. Correct anwer is D.

Correct answer is: B
et's say you create a file system called MyFileSystem and add File1. The new file system now contains 1 GB including metadata. After the hourly update cycle is complete, the total meteredBytes shown by the File Storage service is 1 GB.

questions.question_text:
A few Object Storage buckets in your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) tenancy should remain public, and yet you do not want the Cloud Guard service to detect these as problems.
